column4: Guys I have a question: Anybody know about computer hardware?
I just opened my box to add more RAm to it and I see that I have room for an extra harddrive....
On the hard drive that's already inside there is a power cord and a grey strip that connects the drive to the computer.
I want to put in another drive that I have, but I don't see an extra gre3y strip.
Any ideas?
The black thing that connects to the hard drive?
Once I get the drive connected, how do I get ubuntu to recognize it with out having to re-install the OS?
Once I get the second drive installed, how do I go about reformatting it?
Anybody know how to reformat a second  harddrive thats been added to a box?
I formated the original hard drive during the install. Now I want to add a second hard drive to the box that I already installed Ubuntu on....
do you know the drive name?
You first know its name, fdisk -l will help you there.
No, every partition on linux has a device name such as /dev/hda1
the device name is probabily /dev/hdb1, but use "sudo fdisk -l" as I said earlier to make sure.
lists all the partitions in the partiton table and their device names
you can use fdisk without addin an entry to fstab, fdisk does not format the drive!
What format do you want to use (are you sharing the drive with a windows os?) ext3/fat32 ....
mksfs.ext3 driveName  (but you still have not given us the drive name)
going to be?
the command is then "sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/hdb1"
mksfs.ext3 will also do.
